item.title: Quick and dirty tool for sending UDP packets
item.description: While I was playing with my UDPListener I needed a small tool which could send some UDP packets to a certain hostname and port. That’s why I wrote a console application which uses an UdpClient to send some UDP packets. It’s quick and dirty, but it serves the cause. 1: namespace UdpSender 2: { 3: class Program 4: { 5: //Constants 6: private const string HOSTNAME = "LocalHost"; 7: private const int PORT = 800; 8: private const int TIMES = 5; 9: private const string MESSAGE = "This is a TestMessage"; 10: private const int SLEEP = 50; 11: 12: static void Main(string[] args) 13: { 14: using (UdpClient client = new UdpClient()) 15: { 16: //Connect 17: client.
